question: Virtual Memory of a computer system has which of the following characteristics?
option2: It is as big as maximum addressing capability of the computer system.
option3: It is of size equivalent to total capacity of secondary storage plus size of RAM.
answer: It is as big as maximum addressing capability of the computer system.
explanation: Virtual Memory is an imaginary memory area supported by some operating systems. Virtual memory combines computer's RAM with temporary space on your hard disk.
